info.title: Credential Service API for cheqd network
info.description: API service to create and manage DIDs, Verifiable Credentials, and DID-Linked Resources

post.description: This endpoint issues a Verifiable Credential. As input it takes the list of issuerDid, subjectDid, attributes, and other parameters of the credential to be issued.
This endpoint verifies a Verifiable Credential passed to it. As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself.

parameters.name: verifyStatus
parameters.description: If set to `true` the verification will also check the status of the credential. Requires the VC to have a `credentialStatus` property.

parameters.name: fetchRemoteContexts
parameters.description: When dealing with JSON-LD you also MUST provide the proper contexts. Set this to `true` ONLY if you want the `@context` URLs to be fetched in case they are a custom context.

post.description: This endpoint revokes a given Verifiable Credential. As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself. The StatusList2021 resource should already be setup in the VC and `credentialStatus` property present in the VC.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: This endpoint suspends a given Verifiable Credential.  As input, it can take the VC-JWT as a string or the entire credential itself.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 publisher should manually publish the resource.

parameters.name: publish
parameters.description: Set whether the StatusList2021 resource should be published to the ledger or not. If set to `false`, the StatusList2021 publisher should manually publish the resource.

post.summary: Verify a Verifiable Presentation generated from credential(s).
post.description: This endpoint verifies the Verifiable Presentation generated from credential(s). As input, it can take the Verifiable Presentation JWT as a string or the entire Verifiable Presentation itself.

parameters.name: verifyStatus
parameters.description: If set to `true` the verification will also check the status of the presentation. Requires the VP to have a `credentialStatus` property.

parameters.name: fetchRemoteContexts
parameters.description: When dealing with JSON-LD you also MUST provide the proper contexts. * Set this to `true` ONLY if you want the `@context` URLs to be fetched in case they are a custom context.

post.description: This endpoint creates a new custodian-mode client and creates issuer DIDs and Cosmos/cheqd accounts for the client.

get.description: This endpoint returns the custodian-mode client details for authenticated users.

post.description: This endpoint creates an identity key pair associated with the user's account for custodian-mode clients.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

get.description: This endpoint fetches an identity key pair's details for a given key ID. Only the user account associated with the custodian-mode client can fetch the key pair.

parameters.name: kid
parameters.description: Key ID of the identity key pair to fetch.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint creates a DID and associated DID Document. As input, it can take the DID Document parameters via a form, or the fully-assembled DID Document itself.

400.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

500.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

post.description: This endpoint updates a DID Document. As an input, it can take JUST the sections/parameters that need to be updated in the DID Document (in this scenario, it fetches the current DID Document and applies the updated section). Alternatively, it take the fully-assembled DID Document with updated sections as well as unchanged sections.
This endpoint deactivates a DID Document by taking the DID identifier as input. Must be called and signed by the DID owner.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to deactivate.

post.description: This endpoint creates a DID-Linked Resource. As input, it can take the DID identifier and the resource parameters via a form, or the fully-assembled resource itself.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to link the resource to.

get.description: This endpoint returns the DID-Linked Resource List for a given DID identifier.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier to returns Resource List.

get.description: This endpoint returns the DID-Linked Resource for a given DID identifier and resourceId.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: DID identifier

parameters.name: resourceId
parameters.description: Resource identifier

get.summary: Fetch DIDs associated with an account.
get.description: This endpoint returns the list of DIDs controlled by the account.
This endpoint resolves the latest DID Document for a given DID identifier.

parameters.name: didUrl
parameters.description: DID identifier to resolve.

post.summary: Create a StatusList2021 credential status list.
post.description: This endpoint creates a StatusList2021 credential status list. The StatusList is published as a DID-Linked Resource on ledger. As input, it can can take input parameters needed to create the status list via a form, or a pre-assembled status list in JSON format. Status lists can be created as either encrypted or unencrypted; and with purpose as either revocation or suspension.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension. Once this is set, it cannot be changed. A new status list must be created to change the purpose.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description: Define whether the status list is encrypted. The default is `false`, which means the DID-Linked Resource can be fetched and parsed publicly. Encrypted status lists can only be fetched if the payment conditions are satisfied.

post.summary: Publish a StatusList2021 credential status list.
post.description: Published a pre-assembled StatusList2021 as a DID-Linked Resource. As input, it needs to be provided the `encodedList` property, along with the associated DID-Linked Resource properties in the original status list (if already created previously).

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension. Once this is set, it cannot be changed. A new status list must be created to change the purpose.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description: Define whether the status list is encrypted. The default is `false`, which means the DID-Linked Resource can be fetched and parsed publicly. Encrypted status lists can only be fetched if the payment conditions are satisfied. When publishing a new version, this should match the original property.

get.summary: Fetch StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource based on search criteria.

parameters.name: did
parameters.description: The DID of the issuer of the status list.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension.

parameters.name: statusListName
parameters.description: The name of the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource.

post.summary: Update an existing StatusList2021 credential status list.

parameters.name: statusAction
parameters.description: The update action to be performed on the statuslist, can be revoke, suspend or reinstate

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description: Define whether the status list is encrypted. The default is `false`, which means the DID-Linked Resource can be fetched and parsed publicly. Encrypted status lists can only be fetched if the payment conditions are satisfied. When publishing a new version, this should match the original property.

post.summary: Check a StatusList2021 index for a given Verifiable Credential.
post.description: This endpoint checks a StatusList2021 index for a given Verifiable Credential and reports whether it is revoked or suspended. It offers a standalone method for checking an index without passing the entire Verifiable Credential or Verifiable Presentation.

parameters.name: statusPurpose
parameters.description: The purpose of the status list. Can be either revocation or suspension.

parameters.name: encrypted
parameters.description: Define whether the status list is encrypted. The default is `false`, which means the DID-Linked Resource can be fetched and parsed publicly. Encrypted status lists can only be fetched if the payment conditions are satisfied.

CredentialRequest.description: Input fields for the creating a Verifiable Credential.

issuerDid.description: DID of the Verifiable Credential issuer. This needs to be a `did:cheqd` DID.

subjectDid.description: DID of the Verifiable Credential holder/subject. This needs to be a `did:key` DID.

attributes.description: JSON object containing the attributes to be included in the credential.

@context.description: Optional properties to be included in the `@context` property of the credential.

type.description: Optional properties to be included in the `type` property of the credential.

expirationDate.description: Optional expiration date according to the VC Data Model specification.

format.description: Format of the Verifiable Credential. Defaults to VC-JWT.

credentialStatus.description: Optional `credentialStatus` properties for VC revocation or suspension. Takes `statusListName` and `statusListPurpose` as inputs.

Credential.description: Input fields for revoking/suspending a Verifiable Credential.

credential.description: Verifiable Credential to be revoked as a VC-JWT string or a JSON object.
Verifiable Credential to be verified as a VC-JWT string or a JSON object.

policies.description: Custom verification policies to execute when verifying credential.

now.description: Policy to verify current time during the verification check (provided as Unix/epoch time).

issuanceDate.description: Policy to skip the `issuanceDate` (`nbf`) timestamp check when set to `false`.

expirationDate.description: Policy to skip the `expirationDate` (`exp`) timestamp check when set to `false`.

audience.description: Policy to skip the audience check when set to `false`.

presentation.description: Verifiable Presentation to be verified as a VP-JWT string or a JSON object.

verifiedDid.description: Provide an optional verifier DID (also known as 'domain' parameter), if the verifier DID in the presentation is not managed in the wallet.

policies.description: Custom verification policies to execute when verifying presentation.

now.description: Policy to verify current time during the verification check (provided as Unix/epoch time).

issuanceDate.description: Policy to skip the `issuanceDate` (`nbf`) timestamp check when set to `false`.

expirationDate.description: Policy to skip the `expirationDate` (`exp`) timestamp check when set to `false`.

audience.description: Policy to skip the audience check when set to `false`.

statusListName.description: The name of the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource to be created.

length.description: The length of the status list to be created. The default and minimum length is 140000 which is 16kb.

encoding.description: The encoding format of the StatusList2021 DiD-Linked Resource to be created.

statusListVersion.description: Optional field to assign a human-readable version in the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource.

alsoKnownAs.description: Optional field to assign a set of alternative URIs where the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource can be fetched from.

statusListName.description: The name of the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource to be published.

encodedList.description: The encoding format of the StatusList2021 DiD-Linked Resource to be published.

statusListVersion.description: Optional field to assign a human-readable version in the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource.

alsoKnownAs.description: Optional field to assign a set of alternative URIs where the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource can be fetched from.

statusListName.description: The name of the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource to be updated.

indices.description: List of credential status indices to be updated. The indices must be in the range of the status list.

statusListVersion.description: Optional field to assign a human-readable version in the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource.

statusListName.description: The name of the StatusList2021 DID-Linked Resource to be checked.

index.description: Credential status index to be checked for revocation or suspension.

DidDocument.description: This input field contains either a complete DID document, or an incremental change (diff) to a DID document. See Universal DID Registrar specification.

assertionMethod.description: An assertion method is required to issue JSON-LD credentials.

service.description: Service section of the DID Document.

verificationMethod.description: Verification Method section of the DID Document.

authentication.description: Authentication section of the DID Document.

CreateResourceRequest.description: Input fields for DID-Linked Resource creation.

data.description: Encoded string containing the data to be stored in the DID-Linked Resource.

encoding.description: Encoding format used to encode the data.

type.description: Type of DID-Linked Resource. This is NOT the same as the media type, which is calculated automatically ledger-side.

alsoKnownAs.description: Optional field to assign a set of alternative URIs where the DID-Linked Resource can be fetched from.

version.description: Optional field to assign a human-readable version in the DID-Linked Resource.

InvalidRequest.description: A problem with the input fields has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

InternalError.description: An internal error has occurred. Additional state information plus metadata may be available in the response body.

UnauthorizedError.description: Access token is missing or invalid
